user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_linux_bus_finish:
```c
void metal_linux_bus_finish(void)
{
	struct linux_bus *lbus;
	struct metal_bus *bus;

	for_each_linux_bus(lbus) {
		if (metal_bus_find(lbus->bus_name, &bus) == 0)
			metal_bus_unregister(bus);
	}
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (metal_bus_find(lbus->bus_name, &bus) == 0)
		metal_bus_unregister(bus);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: metal_bus_unregister(bus) is executed only when metal_bus_find(lbus->bus_name, &bus) returns 0, so the call is reachable whenever that condition is true. There is no unreachable code in the shown fragment. (Hypothetical violation could occur only if metal_bus_find is provably constant and never returns 0, making the body dead; nothing in the fragment indicates that.)
